name: Roo.Element

methods.name: getCenterXY
methods.desc: Calculates the x, y to center this element on the screen

methods.name: getScroll
methods.desc: Returns the current scroll position of the element.

returns.desc: An object containing the scroll position in the format {left: (scrollLeft), top: (scrollTop)}

methods.name: createShim
methods.desc:
Creates an iframe shim for this element to keep selects and other windowed objects from
showing through.

methods.name: scrollTo
methods.desc: Scrolls this element the specified scroll point. It does NOT do bounds checking so if you scroll to a weird value it will try to do it. For auto bounds checking, use scroll().

params.name: side
params.desc: Either "left" for scrollLeft values or "top" for scrollTop values.

params.name: value
params.desc: The new scroll value

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: removeAllListeners
methods.desc: Removes all previous added listeners from this element

methods.name: setStyle
methods.desc: Wrapper for setting style properties, also takes single object parameter of multiple styles.

params.name: property
params.desc: The style property to be set, or an object of multiple styles.

params.name: value
params.desc: (optional) The value to apply to the given property, or null if an object was passed.

methods.name: on
methods.desc: Appends an event handler (Shorthand for addListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to append

params.name: fn
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) of the fn

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional)An object with standard {@link Roo.EventManager#addListener} options

methods.name: addClassOnClick
methods.desc: Sets up event handlers to add and remove a css class when the mouse is down and then up on this element (a click effect)

methods.name: getBorderWidth
methods.desc: Gets the width of the border(s) for the specified side(s)

params.name: side
params.desc:
Can be t, l, r, b or any combination of those to add multiple values. For example,
passing lr would get the border (l)eft width + the border (r)ight width.

returns.desc: The width of the sides passed added together

methods.name: scroll
methods.desc:
Scrolls this element the specified direction. Does bounds checking to make sure the scroll is
within this element's scrollable range.

params.name: direction
params.desc: Possible values are: "l","left" - "r","right" - "t","top","up" - "b","bottom","down".

params.name: distance
params.desc: How far to scroll the element in pixels

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

returns.desc:
Returns true if a scroll was triggered or false if the element
was scrolled as far as it could go.

methods.name: addKeyMap
methods.desc: Creates a KeyMap for this element

params.name: config
params.desc: The KeyMap config. See {@link Roo.KeyMap} for more details

methods.name: createChild
methods.desc: Creates the passed DomHelper config and appends it to this element or optionally inserts it before the passed child element.

params.name: config
params.desc:
DomHelper element config object.  If no tag is specified (e.g., {tag:'input'}) then a div will be
automatically generated with the specified attributes.

params.name: insertBefore
params.desc: (optional) a child element of this element

params.name: returnDom
params.desc: (optional) true to return the dom node instead of creating an Element

methods.name: addClass
methods.desc: Adds one or more CSS classes to the element. Duplicate classes are automatically filtered out.

params.name: className
params.desc: The CSS class to add, or an array of classes

methods.name: attr
methods.desc: Sets or Returns the value the dom attribute value

params.name: name
params.desc: The attribute name (or object to set multiple attributes)

params.name: value
params.desc: (optional) The value to set the attribute to

methods.name: setOpacity
methods.desc: Set the opacity of the element

params.name: opacity
params.desc: The new opacity. 0 = transparent, .5 = 50% visibile, 1 = fully visible, etc

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: setSize
methods.desc: Set the size of the element. If animation is true, both width an height will be animated concurrently.

params.name: width
params.desc: The new width

params.name: height
params.desc: The new height

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes an event handler from this element (shorthand for removeListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: the type of event to remove

params.name: fn
params.desc: the method the event invokes

methods.name: up
methods.desc:
Walks up the dom looking for a parent node that matches the passed simple selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child).
This is a shortcut for findParentNode() that always returns an Roo.Element.

params.name: selector
params.desc: The simple selector to test

params.name: maxDepth
params.desc:
(optional) The max depth to
                search as a number or element (defaults to 10 || document.body)

returns.desc: The matching DOM node (or null if no match was found)

methods.name: repaint
methods.desc: Forces the browser to repaint this element

methods.name: translatePoints
methods.desc: Translates the passed page coordinates into left/top css values for this element

params.name: x
params.desc: The page x or an array containing [x, y]

params.name: y
params.desc: The page y

returns.desc: An object with left and top properties. e.g. {left: (value), top: (value)}

methods.name: createProxy
methods.desc: Creates a proxy element of this element

params.name: config
params.desc: The class name of the proxy element or a DomHelper config object

params.name: renderTo
params.desc: (optional) The element or element id to render the proxy to (defaults to document.body)

params.name: matchBox
params.desc: (optional) True to align and size the proxy to this element now (defaults to false)

methods.name: down
methods.desc: Selects a single *direct* child based on the passed CSS selector (the selector should not contain an id).

params.name: selector
params.desc: The CSS selector

params.name: returnDom
params.desc: (optional) True to return the DOM node instead of Roo.Element (defaults to false)

returns.desc: The child Roo.Element (or DOM node if returnDom = true)

methods.name: getBox
methods.desc:
Return a box {x, y, width, height} that can be used to set another elements
size/location to match this element.

params.name: contentBox
params.desc: (optional) If true a box for the content of the element is returned.

params.name: local
params.desc: (optional) If true the element's left and top are returned instead of page x/y.

returns.desc: box An object in the format {x, y, width, height}

methods.name: toggle
methods.desc: Toggles the element's visibility or display, depending on visibility mode.

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) True for the default animation, or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: setBounds
methods.desc: Sets the element's position and size in one shot. If animation is true then width, height, x and y will be animated concurrently.

params.name: x
params.desc: X value for new position (coordinates are page-based)

params.name: y
params.desc: Y value for new position (coordinates are page-based)

params.name: width
params.desc: The new width

params.name: height
params.desc: The new height

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: getX
methods.desc: Gets the current X position of the element based on page coordinates.  Element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

returns.desc: The X position of the element

methods.name: getY
methods.desc: Gets the current Y position of the element based on page coordinates.  Element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

returns.desc: The Y position of the element

methods.name: focus
methods.desc: Tries to focus the element. Any exceptions are caught and ignored.

methods.name: get
methods.desc:
Static method to retrieve Element objects. Uses simple caching to consistently return the same object.
Automatically fixes if an object was recreated with the same id via AJAX or DOM.

params.name: el
params.desc: The id of the node, a DOM Node or an existing Element.

methods.name: autoHeight
methods.desc:
Measures the element's content height and updates height to match. Note: this function uses setTimeout so
the new height may not be available immediately.

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) Animate the transition (defaults to false)

params.name: duration
params.desc: (optional) Length of the animation in seconds (defaults to .35)

params.name: onComplete
params.desc: (optional) Function to call when animation completes

params.name: easing
params.desc: (optional) Easing method to use (defaults to easeOut)

methods.name: scrollIntoView
methods.desc: Scrolls this element into view within the passed container.

params.name: container
params.desc: (optional) The container element to scroll (defaults to document.body)

params.name: hscroll
params.desc: (optional) False to disable horizontal scroll (defaults to true)

methods.name: getAlignToXY
methods.desc:
Gets the x,y coordinates to align this element with another element. See {@link #alignTo} for more info on the
supported position values.

params.name: element
params.desc: The element to align to.

params.name: position
params.desc: The position to align to.

params.name: offsets
params.desc: (optional) Offset the positioning by [x, y]

methods.name: clearOpacity
methods.desc: Clears any opacity settings from this element. Required in some cases for IE.

methods.name: setPositioning
methods.desc: Set positioning with an object returned by getPositioning().

methods.name: getMargins
methods.desc:
Returns an object with properties top, left, right and bottom representing the margins of this element unless sides is passed,
then it returns the calculated width of the sides (see getPadding)

params.name: sides
params.desc: (optional) Any combination of l, r, t, b to get the sum of those sides

methods.name: setRegion
methods.desc: Sets the element's position and size the the specified region. If animation is true then width, height, x and y will be animated concurrently.

params.name: region
params.desc: The region to fill

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: getAttributeNS
methods.desc: Returns the value of a namespaced attribute from the element's underlying DOM node.

params.name: namespace
params.desc: The namespace in which to look for the attribute

params.name: name
params.desc: The attribute name

methods.name: setLeft
methods.desc: Sets the element's left position directly using CSS style (instead of {@link #setX}).

params.name: left
params.desc: The left CSS property value

methods.name: load
methods.desc: Direct access to the UpdateManager update() method (takes the same parameters).

params.name: url
params.desc: The url for this request or a function to call to get the url

params.name: params
params.desc: (optional) The parameters to pass as either a url encoded string "param1=1&param2=2" or an object {param1: 1, param2: 2}

params.name: callback
params.desc: (optional) Callback when transaction is complete - called with signature (oElement, bSuccess)

params.name: discardUrl
params.desc: (optional) By default when you execute an update the defaultUrl is changed to the last used url. If true, it will not store the url.

methods.name: replaceClass
methods.desc: Replaces a CSS class on the element with another.  If the old name does not exist, the new name will simply be added.

params.name: oldClassName
params.desc: The CSS class to replace

params.name: newClassName
params.desc: The replacement CSS class

methods.name: initDDTarget
methods.desc: Initializes a {@link Roo.dd.DDTarget} object for this element.

params.name: group
params.desc: The group the DDTarget object is member of

params.name: config
params.desc: The DDTarget config object

params.name: overrides
params.desc: An object containing methods to override/implement on the DDTarget object

methods.name: setHeight
methods.desc: Set the height of the element

params.name: height
params.desc: The new height

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: clean
methods.desc: Removes worthless text nodes

params.name: forceReclean
params.desc:
(optional) By default the element
keeps track if it has been cleaned already so
you can call this over and over. However, if you update the element and
need to force a reclean, you can pass true.

methods.name: getPositioning
methods.desc:
Gets an object with all CSS positioning properties. Useful along with setPostioning to get
snapshot before performing an update and then restoring the element.

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Update the innerHTML of this element, optionally searching for and processing scripts

params.name: html
params.desc: The new HTML

params.name: loadScripts
params.desc: (optional) true to look for and process scripts

params.name: callback
params.desc: For async script loading you can be noticed when the update completes

methods.name: contains
methods.desc: Returns true if this element is an ancestor of the passed element

params.name: el
params.desc: The element to check

returns.desc: True if this element is an ancestor of el, else false

methods.name: appendChild
methods.desc: Appends the passed element(s) to this element

methods.name: getValue
methods.desc: Returns the value of the "value" attribute

params.name: asNumber
params.desc: true to parse the value as a number

methods.name: getRegion
methods.desc:
Returns the region of the given element.
The element must be part of the DOM tree to have a region (display:none or elements not appended return false).

returns.desc: A Roo.lib.Region containing "top, left, bottom, right" member data.

methods.name: anchorTo
methods.desc: Anchors an element to another element and realigns it when the window is resized.

params.name: element
params.desc: The element to align to.

params.name: position
params.desc: The position to align to.

params.name: offsets
params.desc: (optional) Offset the positioning by [x, y]

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) True for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

params.name: monitorScroll
params.desc:
(optional) True to monitor body scroll and reposition. If this parameter
is a number, it is used as the buffer delay (defaults to 50ms).

params.name: callback
params.desc: The function to call after the animation finishes

methods.name: removeClass
methods.desc: Removes one or more CSS classes from the element.

params.name: className
params.desc: The CSS class to remove, or an array of classes

methods.name: radioClass
methods.desc: Adds one or more CSS classes to this element and removes the same class(es) from all siblings.

params.name: className
params.desc: The CSS class to add, or an array of classes

methods.name: getWidth
methods.desc: Returns the offset width of the element

params.name: contentWidth
params.desc: (optional) true to get the width minus borders and padding

methods.name: insertBefore
methods.desc: Inserts this element before the passed element in the DOM

params.name: el
params.desc: The element to insert before

methods.name: getHeight
methods.desc: Returns the offset height of the element

params.name: contentHeight
params.desc: (optional) true to get the height minus borders and padding

methods.name: setTop
methods.desc: Sets the element's top position directly using CSS style (instead of {@link #setY}).

params.name: top
params.desc: The top CSS property value

methods.name: toggleClass
methods.desc: Toggles the specified CSS class on this element (removes it if it already exists, otherwise adds it).

params.name: className
params.desc: The CSS class to toggle

methods.name: wrap
methods.desc: Creates and wraps this element with another element

params.name: config
params.desc: (optional) DomHelper element config object for the wrapper element or null for an empty div

params.name: returnDom
params.desc: (optional) True to return the raw DOM element instead of Roo.Element

methods.name: setVisible
methods.desc:
Sets the visibility of the element (see details). If the visibilityMode is set to Element.DISPLAY, it will use
the display property to hide the element, otherwise it uses visibility. The default is to hide and show using the visibility property.

params.name: visible
params.desc: Whether the element is visible

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) True for the default animation, or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: addListener
methods.desc: Appends an event handler

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to append

params.name: fn
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) of the fn

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional)An object with standard {@link Roo.EventManager#addListener} options

methods.name: setWidth
methods.desc: Set the width of the element

params.name: width
params.desc: The new width

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: center
methods.desc: Centers the Element in either the viewport, or another Element.

params.name: centerIn
params.desc: (optional) The element in which to center the element.

methods.name: isVisible
methods.desc: Checks whether the element is currently visible using both visibility and display properties.

params.name: deep
params.desc: (optional) True to walk the dom and see if parent elements are hidden (defaults to false)

returns.desc: True if the element is currently visible, else false

methods.name: findParent
methods.desc: Looks at this node and then at parent nodes for a match of the passed simple selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child)

params.name: selector
params.desc: The simple selector to test

params.name: maxDepth
params.desc:
(optional) The max depth to
                search as a number or element (defaults to 10 || document.body)

params.name: returnEl
params.desc: (optional) True to return a Roo.Element object instead of DOM node

returns.desc: The matching DOM node (or null if no match was found)

methods.name: addKeyListener
methods.desc: Convenience method for constructing a KeyMap

params.name: key
params.desc:
Either a string with the keys to listen for, the numeric key code, array of key codes or an object with the following options:
                                 {key: (number or array), shift: (true/false), ctrl: (true/false), alt: (true/false)}

params.name: fn
params.desc: The function to call

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope of the function

methods.name: swallowEvent
methods.desc: Stops the specified event from bubbling and optionally prevents the default action

params.name: preventDefault
params.desc: (optional) true to prevent the default action too

methods.name: getStyles
methods.desc:
Returns an object with properties matching the styles requested.
For example, el.getStyles('color', 'font-size', 'width') might return
{'color': '#FFFFFF', 'font-size': '13px', 'width': '100px'}.

params.name: style1
params.desc: A style name

params.name: style2
params.desc: A style name

methods.name: getSize
methods.desc: Returns the size of the element.

params.name: contentSize
params.desc: (optional) true to get the width/size minus borders and padding

returns.desc: An object containing the element's size {width: (element width), height: (element height)}

methods.name: endMeasure
methods.desc: Restores displays to before beginMeasure was called

methods.name: getViewSize
methods.desc: Returns the width and height of the viewport.

returns.desc: An object containing the viewport's size {width: (viewport width), height: (viewport height)}

methods.name: addClassOnFocus
methods.desc: Sets up event handlers to add and remove a css class when this element has the focus

methods.name: alignTo
methods.desc:
Aligns this element with another element relative to the specified anchor points. If the other element is the document it aligns it to the viewport. The position parameter is optional, and can be specified in any one of the following formats:
  • Blank: Defaults to aligning the element's top-left corner to the target's bottom-left corner ("tl-bl").
  • One anchor (deprecated): The passed anchor position is used as the target element's anchor point. The element being aligned will position its top-left corner (tl) to that point. This method has been deprecated in favor of the newer two anchor syntax below.
  • Two anchors: If two values from the table below are passed separated by a dash, the first value is used as the element's anchor point, and the second value is used as the target's anchor point.
In addition to the anchor points, the position parameter also supports the "?" character. If "?" is passed at the end of the position string, the element will attempt to align as specified, but the position will be adjusted to constrain to the viewport if necessary. Note that the element being aligned might be swapped to align to a different position than that specified in order to enforce the viewport constraints. Following are all of the supported anchor positions: 
    Value  Description
    -----  -----------------------------
    tl     The top left corner (default)
    t      The center of the top edge
    tr     The top right corner
    l      The center of the left edge
    c      In the center of the element
    r      The center of the right edge
    bl     The bottom left corner
    b      The center of the bottom edge
    br     The bottom right corner
Example Usage: 

    // align el to other-el using the default positioning ("tl-bl", non-constrained)
    el.alignTo("other-el");

    // align the top left corner of el with the top right corner of other-el (constrained to viewport)
    el.alignTo("other-el", "tr?");

    // align the bottom right corner of el with the center left edge of other-el
    el.alignTo("other-el", "br-l?");

    // align the center of el with the bottom left corner of other-el and
    // adjust the x position by -6 pixels (and the y position by 0)
    el.alignTo("other-el", "c-bl", [-6, 0]);

params.name: element
params.desc: The element to align to.

params.name: position
params.desc: The position to align to.

params.name: offsets
params.desc: (optional) Offset the positioning by [x, y]

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: insertAfter
methods.desc: Inserts this element after the passed element in the DOM

params.name: el
params.desc: The element to insert after

methods.name: hide
methods.desc: Hide this element - Uses display mode to determine whether to use "display" or "visibility". See {@link #setVisible}.

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: setBottom
methods.desc: Sets the element's CSS bottom style.

params.name: bottom
params.desc: The bottom CSS property value

methods.name: clearPositioning
methods.desc: Clear positioning back to the default when the document was loaded

params.name: value
params.desc: (optional) The value to use for the left,right,top,bottom, defaults to '' (empty string). You could use 'auto'.

methods.name: isDisplayed
methods.desc: Returns true if display is not "none"

methods.name: show
methods.desc: Show this element - Uses display mode to determine whether to use "display" or "visibility". See {@link #setVisible}.

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: setLeftTop
methods.desc: Quick set left and top adding default units

params.name: left
params.desc: The left CSS property value

params.name: top
params.desc: The top CSS property value

methods.name: child
methods.desc: Selects a single child at any depth below this element based on the passed CSS selector (the selector should not contain an id).

params.name: selector
params.desc: The CSS selector

params.name: returnDom
params.desc: (optional) True to return the DOM node instead of Roo.Element (defaults to false)

returns.desc: The child Roo.Element (or DOM node if returnDom = true)

methods.name: unmask
methods.desc:
Removes a previously applied mask. If removeEl is true the mask overlay is destroyed, otherwise
it is cached for reuse.

methods.name: moveTo
methods.desc:
Sets the position of the element in page coordinates, regardless of how the element is positioned.
The element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

params.name: x
params.desc: X value for new position (coordinates are page-based)

params.name: y
params.desc: Y value for new position (coordinates are page-based)

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) True for the default animation, or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: addClassOnOver
methods.desc: Sets up event handlers to add and remove a css class when the mouse is over this element

params.name: preventFlicker
params.desc:
(optional) If set to true, it prevents flickering by filtering
mouseout events for children elements

methods.name: getLeft
methods.desc: Gets the left X coordinate

params.name: local
params.desc: True to get the local css position instead of page coordinate

methods.name: isScrollable
methods.desc: Returns true if this element is scrollable.

methods.name: boxWrap
methods.desc:
Wraps the specified element with a special markup/CSS block that renders by default as a gray container with a
gradient background, rounded corners and a 4-way shadow.

params.name: class
params.desc:
(optional) A base CSS class to apply to the containing wrapper element (defaults to 'x-box').
Note that there are a number of CSS rules that are dependent on this name to make the overall effect work,
so if you supply an alternate base class, make sure you also supply all of the necessary rules.

methods.name: replace
methods.desc: Replaces the passed element with this element

params.name: el
params.desc: The element to replace

methods.name: select
methods.desc: Creates a {@link Roo.CompositeElement} for child nodes based on the passed CSS selector (the selector should not contain an id).

params.name: selector
params.desc: The CSS selector

params.name: unique
params.desc: (optional) True to create a unique Roo.Element for each child (defaults to false, which creates a single shared flyweight object)

methods.name: isMasked
methods.desc: Returns true if this element is masked

methods.name: getUpdateManager
methods.desc: Gets this element's UpdateManager

methods.name: insertHtml
methods.desc: Inserts an html fragment into this element

params.name: where
params.desc: Where to insert the html in relation to the this element - beforeBegin, afterBegin, beforeEnd, afterEnd.

params.name: html
params.desc: The HTML fragment

params.name: returnEl
params.desc: True to return an Roo.Element

returns.desc: The inserted node (or nearest related if more than 1 inserted)

methods.name: mask
methods.desc:
Puts a mask over this element to disable user interaction. Requires core.css.
This method can only be applied to elements which accept child nodes.

params.name: msg
params.desc: (optional) A message to display in the mask

params.name: msgCls
params.desc: (optional) A css class to apply to the msg element

methods.name: getTop
methods.desc: Gets the top Y coordinate

params.name: local
params.desc: True to get the local css position instead of page coordinate

methods.name: getBottom
methods.desc: Gets the bottom Y coordinate of the element (element Y position + element height)

params.name: local
params.desc: True to get the local css position instead of page coordinate

methods.name: getRight
methods.desc: Gets the right X coordinate of the element (element X position + element width)

params.name: local
params.desc: True to get the local css position instead of page coordinate

methods.name: beginMeasure
methods.desc: Temporarily enables offsets (width,height,x,y) for an element with display:none, use endMeasure() when done.

methods.name: appendTo
methods.desc: Appends this element to the passed element

params.name: el
params.desc: The new parent element

methods.name: fly
methods.desc:
Gets the globally shared flyweight Element, with the passed node as the active element. Do not store a reference to this element -
the dom node can be overwritten by other code.

params.name: el
params.desc: The dom node or id

params.name: named
params.desc:
(optional) Allows for creation of named reusable flyweights to
                                 prevent conflicts (e.g. internally Roo uses "_internal")

methods.name: hasClass
methods.desc: Checks if the specified CSS class exists on this element's DOM node.

params.name: className
params.desc: The CSS class to check for

returns.desc: True if the class exists, else false

methods.name: findScrollableParent
methods.desc: Looks at  the scrollable parent element

methods.name: fitToParent
methods.desc:
Sizes this element to its parent element's dimensions performing
neccessary box adjustments.

params.name: monitorResize
params.desc: (optional) If true maintains the fit when the browser window is resized.

params.name: targetParent
params.desc: (optional) The target parent, default to the parentNode.

methods.name: setXY
methods.desc:
Sets the position of the element in page coordinates, regardless of how the element is positioned.
The element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

params.name: pos
params.desc: Contains X & Y [x, y] values for new position (coordinates are page-based)

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) True for the default animation, or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: getXY
methods.desc: Gets the current position of the element based on page coordinates.  Element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

returns.desc: The XY position of the element

methods.name: unselectable
methods.desc: Disables text selection for this element (normalized across browsers)

methods.name: blur
methods.desc: Tries to blur the element. Any exceptions are caught and ignored.

methods.name: setRight
methods.desc: Sets the element's CSS right style.

params.name: right
params.desc: The right CSS property value

methods.name: findParentNode
methods.desc: Looks at parent nodes for a match of the passed simple selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child)

params.name: selector
params.desc: The simple selector to test

params.name: maxDepth
params.desc:
(optional) The max depth to
                search as a number or element (defaults to 10 || document.body)

params.name: returnEl
params.desc: (optional) True to return a Roo.Element object instead of DOM node

returns.desc: The matching DOM node (or null if no match was found)

methods.name: position
methods.desc:
Initializes positioning on this element. If a desired position is not passed, it will make the
the element positioned relative IF it is not already positioned.

params.name: pos
params.desc: (optional) Positioning to use "relative", "absolute" or "fixed"

params.name: zIndex
params.desc: (optional) The zIndex to apply

params.name: x
params.desc: (optional) Set the page X position

params.name: y
params.desc: (optional) Set the page Y position

methods.name: getFrameWidth
methods.desc:
Returns the sum width of the padding and borders for the passed "sides". See getBorderWidth()
         for more information about the sides.

methods.name: setLocation
methods.desc:
Sets the position of the element in page coordinates, regardless of how the element is positioned.
The element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

params.name: x
params.desc: X value for new position (coordinates are page-based)

params.name: y
params.desc: Y value for new position (coordinates are page-based)

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) True for the default animation, or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: unclip
methods.desc: Return clipping (overflow) to original clipping before clip() was called

methods.name: set
methods.desc: Sets the passed attributes as attributes of this element (a style attribute can be a string, object or function)

params.name: o
params.desc: The object with the attributes

params.name: useSet
params.desc: (optional) false to override the default setAttribute to use expandos.

methods.name: setDisplayed
methods.desc: Sets the CSS display property. Uses originalDisplay if the specified value is a boolean true.

params.name: value
params.desc: Boolean value to display the element using its default display, or a string to set the display directly

methods.name: insertFirst
methods.desc: Inserts (or creates) an element (or DomHelper config) as the first child of the this element

params.name: el
params.desc: The id or element to insert or a DomHelper config to create and insert

methods.name: animate
methods.desc: Perform animation on this element.

params.name: args
params.desc: The YUI animation control args

params.name: duration
params.desc: (optional) How long the animation lasts in seconds (defaults to .35)

params.name: onComplete
params.desc: (optional) Function to call when animation completes

params.name: easing
params.desc: (optional) Easing method to use (defaults to 'easeOut')

params.name: animType
params.desc: (optional) 'run' is the default. Can also be 'color', 'motion', or 'scroll'

methods.name: enableDisplayMode
methods.desc: Convenience method for setVisibilityMode(Element.DISPLAY)

params.name: display
params.desc: (optional) What to set display to when visible

methods.name: getComputedWidth
methods.desc:
Returns either the offsetWidth or the width of this element based on CSS width adjusted by padding or borders
when needed to simulate offsetWidth when offsets aren't available. This may not work on display:none elements
if a width has not been set using CSS.

methods.name: clip
methods.desc: Store the current overflow setting and clip overflow on the element - use {@link #unclip} to remove

methods.name: setVisibilityMode
methods.desc:
Sets the element's visibility mode. When setVisible() is called it
will use this to determine whether to set the visibility or the display property.

params.name: visMode
params.desc: Element.VISIBILITY or Element.DISPLAY

methods.name: getColor
methods.desc:
Return the CSS color for the specified CSS attribute. rgb, 3 digit (like #fff) and valid values
are convert to standard 6 digit hex color.

params.name: attr
params.desc: The css attribute

params.name: defaultValue
params.desc: The default value to use when a valid color isn't found

params.name: prefix
params.desc:
(optional) defaults to #. Use an empty string when working with
YUI color anims.

methods.name: insertSibling
methods.desc: Inserts (or creates) the passed element (or DomHelper config) as a sibling of this element

params.name: el
params.desc: The id or element to insert or a DomHelper config to create and insert

params.name: where
params.desc: (optional) 'before' or 'after' defaults to before

params.name: returnDom
params.desc: (optional) True to return the raw DOM element instead of Roo.Element

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes an event handler from this element

params.name: eventName
params.desc: the type of event to remove

params.name: fn
params.desc: the method the event invokes

methods.name: applyStyles
methods.desc: More flexible version of {@link #setStyle} for setting style properties.

params.name: styles
params.desc:
A style specification string, e.g. "width:100px", or object in the form {width:"100px"}, or
a function which returns such a specification.

methods.name: getPrevSibling
methods.desc: Gets the previous sibling, skipping text nodes

methods.name: setBox
methods.desc: Sets the element's box. Use getBox() on another element to get a box obj. If animate is true then width, height, x and y will be animated concurrently.

params.name: box
params.desc: The box to fill {x, y, width, height}

params.name: adjust
params.desc: (optional) Whether to adjust for box-model issues automatically

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: initDDProxy
methods.desc: Initializes a {@link Roo.dd.DDProxy} object for this element.

params.name: group
params.desc: The group the DDProxy object is member of

params.name: config
params.desc: The DDProxy config object

params.name: overrides
params.desc: An object containing methods to override/implement on the DDProxy object

methods.name: setX
methods.desc: Sets the X position of the element based on page coordinates.  Element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

params.name: The
params.desc: X position of the element

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) True for the default animation, or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: setY
methods.desc: Sets the Y position of the element based on page coordinates.  Element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

params.name: The
params.desc: Y position of the element

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) True for the default animation, or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: query
methods.desc: Selects child nodes based on the passed CSS selector (the selector should not contain an id).

params.name: selector
params.desc: The CSS selector

returns.desc: An array of the matched nodes

methods.name: getAnchorXY
methods.desc: Gets the x,y coordinates specified by the anchor position on the element.

params.name: anchor
params.desc: (optional) The specified anchor position (defaults to "c").  See {@link #alignTo} for details on supported anchor positions.

params.name: size
params.desc:
(optional) An object containing the size to use for calculating anchor position
                      {width: (target width), height: (target height)} (defaults to the element's current size)

params.name: local
params.desc: (optional) True to get the local (element top/left-relative) anchor position instead of page coordinates

returns.desc: [x, y] An array containing the element's x and y coordinates

methods.name: initDD
methods.desc: Initializes a {@link Roo.dd.DD} drag drop object for this element.

params.name: group
params.desc: The group the DD object is member of

params.name: config
params.desc: The DD config object

params.name: overrides
params.desc: An object containing methods to override/implement on the DD object

methods.name: getComputedHeight
methods.desc:
Returns either the offsetHeight or the height of this element based on CSS height adjusted by padding or borders
when needed to simulate offsetHeight when offsets aren't available. This may not work on display:none elements
if a height has not been set using CSS.

methods.name: is
methods.desc: Returns true if this element matches the passed simple selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child)

params.name: selector
params.desc: The simple selector to test

returns.desc: True if this element matches the selector, else false

methods.name: move
methods.desc: Move this element relative to its current position.

params.name: direction
params.desc: Possible values are: "l","left" - "r","right" - "t","top","up" - "b","bottom","down".

params.name: distance
params.desc: How far to move the element in pixels

params.name: animate
params.desc: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

methods.name: remove
methods.desc: Removes this element from the DOM and deletes it from the cache

methods.name: getNextSibling
methods.desc: Gets the next sibling, skipping text nodes

methods.name: getStyle
methods.desc: Normalizes currentStyle and computedStyle. This is not YUI getStyle, it is an optimised version.

params.name: property
params.desc: The style property whose value is returned.

returns.desc: The current value of the style property for this element.

methods.name: isBorderBox
methods.desc: Tests various css rules/browsers to determine if this element uses a border box

methods.name: getPadding
methods.desc: Gets the width of the padding(s) for the specified side(s)

params.name: side
params.desc:
Can be t, l, r, b or any combination of those to add multiple values. For example,
passing lr would get the padding (l)eft + the padding (r)ight.

returns.desc: The padding of the sides passed added together
